text: WENTY HIRD UNDAY IN RDINARY IME September 6 2020 Having spent the entire month of August preparing this weekend September 5th6th finally brings us into the fourth great discourse of St Matthews Gospel The Discourse on the Church In this portion of the discourse our blessed Lord speaks on how to approach members of the Church who have sinned and offer them correction Matthew 181518 as well as the efficacy of prayer offered in His name Matthew 181920 This discourse will continue next week as we hear about the forgiveness that must be repeatedly extended to sinful members who repent Matthew 1821 35 When speaking of the different approaches to fraternal correction our blessed Lord makes use of the term the Church This term is used in the sense of a social structure and an actual community one that is visible and directly dependent on Him and His twelve apostles and their successors These are the sames successors who are headed by St Peter who himself has been given by our blessed Lord the allembracing power of the keys Matthew 161819 and they have a spiritual authority that God Himself backs up Among this authority is that of forgiving or retaining sins of receiving people into the Church or if necessary cutting them off from communion with the Church This is a remarkable power given by Jesus to the hierarchy and is beautifully found in the Sacrament of Confession It has been protected by a special kind of divine providence in the form of Jesus continuous presence in the Church and the Holy Spirits support of its hierarchical Magisterium This is followed by the passage Matthew 181920 in which Jesus promises to be present whenever a number of Christians come together to pray Through our baptism we have become members of the Body of Christ the Church 1 Corinthians 121213 And as St Joan of Arc declared in the 15th Century About Jesus Christ and the Church I simply know theyre just one thing and we shouldnt complicate the matter Therefore wherever the Body is gathered so is the Head found 34th Annual Bishops Appeal and Parish Bulletins As announced last weekend we are about to start the 34th Annual Bishops Appeal Spreading the Light of Gods Love This yearly fundraising campaign supports a wide variety of ministries and programs throughout the Diocese Our parish goal for this year is 3537151 All donations that exceed our goal will return to St Joseph Next week you will receive a letter from Bishop Rhoades to kickoff the Appeal The following weekend September 19th20th we will show the Appeal video before each of our weekend Masses and will have your Appeal pledge cards available in the Narthex On behalf of all those aided by the Appeal thank you for prayerfully discerning how you may support this years Appeal Following the latest Diocesan directives we are able to once again pass out physical copies of our bulletins after weekend Masses Printed bulletins will once again be available after all weekend Masses starting in October For those who have not yet returned to Mass inperson andor would prefer to continue receiving our weekly mailing of this bulletin newsletter we will continue to mail them out In anticipation for the return of hardcopy bulletins you will receive an insert in our weekly mailing The insert will provide instructions on how to inform our Parish Office if you would like to continue to receive this weekly mailing or not Watch for that insert in the next week or two Faithfully in Christ Fr David MASS INTENTIONS Saturday September 5 8:00am Special Intention 8:30am Rosary 4:00pm Confessions 4:35pm
